subsection_content:
1. Use medication
Medicines to treat sinusitis include pain relievers and antibiotics:
Pain relievers (paracetamol, ibuprofen) help reduce unpleasant symptoms caused by sinuses such as headaches, pressure in the cheeks and forehead.; Antibiotics: If symptoms of headache, cough, stuffy nose... last for several weeks, you may be prescribed antibiotics. Dosage may last 3-14 days, depending on your doctor's instructions.
2. Surgery
Surgery may be performed if all of the above solutions do not work. Surgical procedures can clear the sinuses, remove polys, or correct a deviated septum.
3. Other measures
If the above remedies are not effective, your doctor may prescribe additional tests to determine whether your sinusitis is caused by allergies. (4)
